newsitem.title: CANADA: Romania minister to talk NATO expansion with Ottawa.
newsitem.headline: Romania minister to talk NATO expansion with Ottawa.

text.p: Romanian Foreign Minister Teodor Melescanu arrived in Canada on Friday for talks with Canadian government officials on NATO expansion in Eastern Europe and trade.
He was scheduled to meet International Trade Minister Art Eggleton and Industry Minister John Manley. A planned meeting with Prime Minister Jean Chretien was canceled.
A Canadian foreign affairs spokesman said Canada looked favorably on NATO expansion in Eastern Europe but was "neither encouraging nor discouraging" Romania's candidacy.
He said NATO expansion should be accomplished through consultations with all concerned countries.

Since the 1989 fall of communism in Europe, Romania has built its foreign policy on striving for NATO and European Union membership. It was the first former communist country to sign up for the Partnership for Peace program of military links between NATO and Eastern Europe.
